documents.document:
*sigh*

i love winter vacation and all but man in winnipeg there is absolutly nothing to do! i bored out of my mind

i hate school!!(except science!!!)

well exams are soon and i'm sssssooooo unhappy. i hate my pre-cal teacher he's so bad, and he's supposed to give us a sheet of formulas for all the tests this year but he didn't and now we have to memorize a million formulas for the exam. i can't stand him..... AAAAUUUGGGGGHHHHHH.

ssssssooooooo cold!!!!

well today it was -48 with windchill. so no buses were running(i happen to take one), and school was canclled !!!!! i'm so appy!!!!!!

exam week...nnnnnnnnooooooooo!!

i have no schol today but tommorow i have my science exam(which i know i'll pass )
it's my math exam i'm worried about, my math teacher was horrible and almost everyone never gets his lessons(all except the really smart, and teachers pet people). at least i know that if i get 0 on the exam my mark will be 58%, which is passing. i wouldn't last a second in my house without my parents murdering me though. . there so hypocritical...they always tell me to do my best and then when i get an 80% their all like why didn't u do better. and my sister is an A+ student so they always judge me on that matter... when i was younger we gave ourselves self evaluations, i gave myself high marks and my parents would get mad, but i would say i thought you wanted me to be as good as my sister. and my parents always over look my good marks and go straight to the bad ones and asking me why the hell i got those marks. they always say there proud of me but ya right thats a bunch of bullshit!!! (sorry about the ranting i'm just really mad and...sad... )

oh my god*ssssoooo happy!!!*

wow! couple days ago i found out that on my science exam i got...95% booya!! i'm soo happy, but i still don't know what my math mark is and that worries me...

Woot!

i had a gymnastics compitition today and guess who got first ......Me! i'm so happy and proud my first first of the season! booya! . this compitition was the third and theres about ten so theres only room for improvement!!!!LOL

FOOTBALL!!!!

well my school is finally getting a football team this year! i tried out for the basketball team but didn't make it so i decided i wanted to try another sport. the football team came along just in time!!! i'm going to try out*even though my parents don't like the idea* i may even make it if the school is going to do the thing where everyone is on the team but if u don't show up for a game or practice ur out. fingers crossed that there doing it that way!!!!!

AUGH!!!!!!!!!

i can't beleive my parents. they wouldn't even let me try out for the football team! they tell me to find a sport to play at school and when i do they just shove it and my hopes in the garbage... o nathan it's a co-ed team but u don't have to worry now...

what kind of animal activist is this guy?

i found out that in germany a baby polar bear was rejected by it's mother, and was taken by a zoo. all was well and fine untill some stupid animal activist butted in. this person was all like 'people shouldn't have interfered, and the zoo should euthinize it' *for those people who don't know what that means... to put the animal to sleep*basically the "animal activist" wants to kill a baby of a speices that is endangoured!!! what kind of funking idiot is this person.(excuse the language please). and this person calls its self an animal activist! i sorry about raving but i'm really sensitive on the subject of animals! and this person reallly irritated me!

can't wait for summer.

duh, i know everyone can't wait for summer... but i get to go to europe for a month! . first i'm going to austria for about a week, then i'm going to germany for a few days then i'm traveling down trough italy and then to sicily to visit relatives. of course my mom, dad, and sister are coming!

he night skies eye's and the moon stories (peom/story)

I run through the night,
Through trees, and bushes, rocks, and sand.
Always running,
Nights cold kiss apon my cheeks,
Autumn’s cool breath leaves my lips with quickness,
Though I never tire;
Never stop; never quit.
The nights beautiful eyes sparkle down on me,
Watching, though never judging.
I look at the moon’s fullness,
It’s always full when I run,
Always enchanting my eyes with its constant beauty,
Telling me stories though never saying a word.
The path ahead becomes rough and uneasy,
I stumble many times falling,
Getting back up and falling again,
I fall one more time and my body stops,
The run had taken strength and I look to the night sky,
The night sky, in which starry eyes twinkle, I is dark blue,
But begins to fade and the sky becomes black,
Fear and anguish rushes through me,
Everything begins to fade, the trees and bushes, rocks and sand,
I remember the ruff ground that I ran over.
It reminded me of ocean waves,
It reminded me why I was running, and where I was running.
Slowly I begin to get up
The starry sky, and landscape reappear and I run once more,
The jagged rocks turn to lush sand,
And soon I’m running against the waves of the ocean,
I see myself doing so, yet I’m watching myself disappear into the gleaming horizon
Disappear into the sunrays, the bright rays,
Blinding me, reaching out to me, warming me...

I open my eyes and find myself in a room.
The sun blazing through the window by the bed I lay on,
The rays glimmer off the white washed walls and medical equipment
A woman standing over me looks at me with delight,
Her grey hair in a bun, and her blue eyes sparkle with excitement
She sits on the bed and tells me “your in a hospital, congratulations, you survived!”

By Stacey Collerone

Tell me what u think...

freezing (poem/story)

As the wind moaned and howled
I stared at the horrible sight
There I stood, and raging before me was what I feared the most.
I trembled violently, closing my eyes
Wishing for, with my luck, that he, my fear, would go away.
I dared not open my eyes, to see that sight…
Then I began trembling again, but not of fear, of a cold, freezing touch.
I moved away from the touch but it followed me
I tried again, eyes still closed, the touch automatically came back.
A shiver washed over me; as he blew his cold breath down my back
And I panicked; I could almost feel his joy eradiating off him.
I could feel the freezing slowly taking over my body.
There was no escape, no rescue; the battle was mine to fight alone.
My breath became short gasps and the shivering seemed never ending
My body could no longer move.
I felt no hope, only gut-wrenching fear
My mind was the only working thing left and as I thought I remembered a saying, “The only way to not fear is to face what you fear the most.”
But how could I face him
Me of all people, all my life I’ve been afraid and had not the courage to face anything
Had I not seen him already? But not in detail.
I was so afraid that I hadn’t gotten a good look at him.
I gathered enough courage to try to open my eyes but they had frozen shut
Just as I began to panic again, I felt a sudden warmth of life.
At first I had thought I’d be fighting this battle alone but help arrived.
The warmth managed to unfreeze my eyes
I opened one at a time, what I saw was only darkness
My fear was anguished and the warmth grew.
And as it grew so did the light.
At that moment of sudden courage, a courage I’d never felt before, I saw him, really saw him.
The thing I’ve been afraid to open my eyes to see.
He was so close to me, I hadn’t realized his breath, but for some reason now I did.
I was invited to the rancid smell of death.
I freaked, his touch, his face, everything about him I feared
Closing my eyes tight I began to shiver once more, but the cold didn’t return warm life had gotten the cold death away from me.
Life prodded me to open my eyes without a word.
I obeyed his silent order and was rewarded with a warm smile from life.
Death being impatient attacked life, but life was ready.
I watched in awe as the battle wore on.
It was an epic battle between the warm sword blade of life and the freezing sword of death.
I knew why life had me open my eyes, he knew he’d need my help…
It struck me that yet again I’d have to face that gut-wrenching fear.
Could I face it? Could I help life, my savior, from death?
As I contemplated death managed to pin life.
“No,” I screamed as death lifted his weapon for the final blow.
Death looked up, and I gave a shudder.
That face, I knew it but whom? No, no, no!
It was my archenemy Nat!
Anger gave me power to speak again, “you wanted me so come and get me!” I exclaimed, with more courage in my voice then I felt.
Why? Why did I do that?
Fear, like the courage, I’d never felt until those agonizingly slow moments when death…Nat came to stand over me.
His yellow eyes pierced into me, and his dirty blond hair blew in a breeze that only seemed to be around him.
Life was saved that’s all that mattered.
Now life could help others from a fate I was soon to encounter.
As long as life was okay dying seem normal even though I've only lived 15 years.
Looking around Nat I could see life’s face as he had managed to get up and stalk towards us.
Life had sharp red eyes and light brown hair…I saw my boyfriend Dakota’s face!
No wonder I cared so deeply for life!
The time Nat took to savor his victory Dakota reached us.
Dakota’s blade sliced easily into Nat,
gasping Nat clutched his heart and disappeared.
Though I knew that a time would come when I’d see death, but not as Nat…
Dakota and I hugged, he stroked my dark brown hair and he looked lovingly into my bright teal eyes.
He began to disappear and was soon gone.
The dim light of my inner world faded to a blinding white.
* * * * * * * * * * *
I looked up… I was lying down in a bed and I saw my parents by each of my sides. “Oh, my Emma.” My mother said gently hugging me. “What happened?” I managed to ask. “ You were skating when Nat came along and started a fight with you. You’d been knocked unconscious and almost froze when Dakota found you… Nat wanting your obvious death came and attacked Dakota.” My mother continued with a sudden proudness in her eyes, “ you awoke to find Nat pinning Dakota. You attacked and both you and Nat rolled onto the thin ice. It broke, but Dakota saved you... he didn’t…” my mother trailed off. Dakota hobbled into the hospital room doorway and finished the story, “ but I didn’t have enough energy to save Nat.” For a long moment we stared at each other, happy. my eyes closed and my inner world came into my view.
* * * * * * * * * *
I sat on the edge of a cliff over looking an ocean.
I looked up and Dakota sat beside me, the sun setting light shimmered off the water in a beautiful array of colors.
And there we sat holding hands…
